name: Sazani Beach Hotel

reviews.text: The Sazani was one of the highlights of our trip to Tanzania. It seems like a long way from civilization; it's quite a drive from the airport. But upon arrival, I was sure we had arrived in an unrivaled paradise. Yes, it's a bit rough around the edges and a very poor choice for those of you looking for the elegance of a a 5 star resort. The rooms are beautifully basic and there's not nightly turn down service. But it's a GORGEOUS location on a fantastic beach and everything about it is pure magic for me.
reviews.title: A highlight in Zanaibar

reviews.text: Manager Michael is one of those great characters that you find when you travel to interesting places. He's perfectly English and full of Blarney. Hang out at his bar for a bit and your sure to hear some wonderful stories. Be sure to ask him about the last Tsunami warning! You'll be ready to go down with him and the bar!
reviews.title: Pure relaxation at Sazani Beach

reviews.text: We did some diving with Helen at the dive centre. She was a fine dive master and the water was very, very fine. We snorkeled with dolfins and saw a million fish!
reviews.title: The right retreat/the right balance/the right place...

likes.disliked: — 30 minutes from restaurant options (hotel provides food)

reviews.text: All told, the Sazani is the kind of travel secret that you hope the world never finds out about so the prices remain low and the place stays wonderfully basic. If it sounds good, enjoy. If no - please stay away!
reviews.title: Other Places

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sazani Beach hotel was clearly a great place back in the day (if you look at the older reviews, it sounds like the management made this place very special). Sadly, it has become a shadow of its former self: it is very run down, the beach is dirty, it has an abandoned and disheveled feel, and it desperately needs major renovation.
reviews.title: Seen Better Days, But Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Why didn't we just run a mile when we checked in (we were the only people staying there)? Because we were tired from a big trip, the location is amazing (the stretch of beach south and north of the hotel is fantastic), and because we kind of liked having the entire place to ourselves. We also vaguely enjoyed the challenge of making sure we still enjoyed ourselves despite the lodgings!
reviews.title: Terrible - stay away from this place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: OK, so here is what we did not find appealing: the mosquito nets were old, musty, and full of holes (solution: we put tape over the holes), the room was really damp smelling (solution: burn incense), and there was trash littered around the hotel and the beach (solution: we tried to clean it up ourselves).
reviews.title: Paradise and frinedly staff

reviews.text: The whole place reminded us a little of a dirtier and unkempt version of Derek Jarman's famous garden (http://www.flickr.com/photos/angusf/sets/656542/).
reviews.title: lovely lovely lovely

reviews.text: There were, however, a few nice touches: flowers on our bed when we arrived and more flowers when the room was made up in the morning; good breakfasts.
reviews.title: A Home Away from Home

description: Feel like a castaway at our 10 room beach lodge, a perfect paradise for beach lovers, kite surfers and divers. An oasis of calm just five minute taxi ride from Nungwi's busy strip of music bars and hotels. Our bungalows are designed in a traditional Swahilli style with coconut thatch roofs in a tropical garden setting, each with a sea view and sandy path down to our secluded pristine beach and the turquoise ocean. Stay with us and help us to develop our sustainability ethos to be an environmentally and socially responsible hotel.
